page.title: 11Housing
page.content: There are many examples of old stone houses made from local limestone.The old quarry east of Little Ponton is now closed but there is a new one near the railway bridge at Great Ponton. Most of the recent developments occured in the 1960's it was then that the old people's bungalows and the council houses in Cringleway were built.Several old stone cottages were demolished to make way for them. The disused Primitive Chapel became a dwelling in the 1940's but was pulled down to make room for 8 council houses( built around 1956). There is some concern about the mixing between the new people in the village and older residents.Those who moved in,in the 1960's tend to keep separate from the natives,having their own community centre.
